definition: counselor of king or feudal warlord/henchman

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131

sentences.english: Thus, retainers'system is an important way of forming bureaucracy system in the Warring States times.
sentences.chinese: 由此，家臣制便成爲戰國官僚制形成的重要途徑。

sentences.english: Photo 2 shows the valves with the valve spring retainers ready to go.
sentences.chinese: 圖片2顯示閥與氣門彈簧家臣準備。

sentences.english: I do not have dentures, but I have a clear retainer.
sentences.chinese: 我不戴假牙，但我有一個清晰的家臣。

sentences.english: In the second part, it investigates the setting and responsibility of retainers during the Spring and Autumn period.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分，對春秋家臣的設置和職司進行了研究。

definition: a member of the same clan/a distant relative with the same family name
high-ranking officials in the court of a Chinese emperor
(orig.) tents forming the offices of a commanding officer/administration of a military government/(medieval Japan) "bakufu", administration of the shogun
ODA Nobunaga (1534-1582), Japanese shogun (warlord), played an important role in unifying Japan
